text: MCP stands for Model Context Protocol.
MCP allows AI models to access external tools and data.
Python is widely used for AI and machine learning projects.
Monte Carlo simulations are used for probabilistic modeling.
AI models can be integrated with APIs to get real-time data.
MCP is a protocol that standardizes how models interact with tools.
Open-source MCP servers can expose databases, files, and services.
MCP clients send requests to MCP servers to get contextual data.
MCP helps agents perform actions beyond plain text generation.
Weather data in this mock project is simulated and not real.
Machine learning models need training data to make predictions.
Neural networks are a key part of deep learning.
Natural language processing allows machines to understand text.
Reinforcement learning trains agents by reward feedback.
Python's libraries like pandas and numpy simplify data analysis.
MCP makes it easier for AI agents to access structured and unstructured data.
Simulated weather information is returned by the MCP server for demonstration purposes.
The MCP protocol can be extended to custom tools beyond weather and search.
Offline MCP agents rely on mock databases to answer general queries.
The mock database contains entries about AI, MCP, Python, and general knowledge for testing.
